 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְח֫שֶׁת‎</span><sub>137</sub> **noun masculine**<sup>[[1Kgs.7.45|1Kgs 7:45]]</sup> (compare [[BDB#Albr.|Albr]]<sup>ZAW xvi (1896), 108</sup>; feminine[[1Chr.18.8|1Chr 18:8]]) ==copper, bronze== (Late Hebrew = Biblical Hebrew; Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נחשת‎</span>; Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נחשא‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>322</sup>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחָשָׁא‎</span>, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (so also Old Ethiopic [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>Epigr.Denkm.aus Abess.(1894),52</sup>); [[BDB#WMM|WMM]]<sup>As.u.Eur.127 cites Egyptian</sup> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***teµ(µ)ost***</u></abbr>, ***copper*** (= \*<abbr title="transliteration"><u>***tenµost***</u></abbr>), as loan-word from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחשֶׁת‎</span> + feminine article); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> absolute [[Gen.4.22|Gen 4:22]] +; construct [[Exod.38.29|Exod 38:29]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתִּי‎</span> [[Lam.3.7|Lam 3:7]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתֵךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.16.36|Ezek 16:36]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתָּהּ‎</span> [[Ezek.24.11|Ezek 24:11]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתָּם‎</span> [[2Kgs.25.13|2Kgs 25:13]] + 2 t.; dual <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתַּ֫יִם‎</span> [[Judg.16.21|Judg 16:21]] + 6 t.; — 

**1.** ***copper***, as ore [[Deut.8.9|Deut 8:9]], compare [[Zech.6.8|Zech 6:8]] worked by artificer [[Gen.4.22|Gen 4:22]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[1Kgs.7.14|1Kgs 7:14]] (twice in verse); [[2Chr.24.12|2Chr 24:12]] material — doubtless hardened with alloy, probably tin, making ***bronze***, compare [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archaeology i. 243</sup> [[BDB#Benz|Benz]]<sup>Archaeology 214</sup> — of armour [[1Sam.17.5|1Sam 17:5]]; [[1Sam.17.6|1Sam 17:6]]; [[1Kgs.14.27|1Kgs 14:27]], utensils [[2Kgs.25.14|2Kgs 25:14]] = [[Jer.52.18|Jer 52:18]]; [[Lev.6.21|Lev 6:21]]; [[Num.17.4|Num 17:4]] + very often, altar [[2Kgs.16.14|2Kgs 16:14]]; [[2Kgs.16.15|2Kgs 16:15]]; [[Exod.38.30|Exod 38:30]]; [[Exod.39.39|Exod 39:39]], etc., and other objects [[Num.21.9|Num 21:9]] (twice in verse) ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]), [[2Kgs.18.4|2Kgs 18:4]]; [[1Kgs.4.13|1Kgs 4:13]]; [[1Kgs.7.15|1Kgs 7:15]]ff. +, especially in description of tabernacle and temple; cast [[1Kgs.7.14|1Kgs 7:14]] polished <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְמֹרָט‎</span> v[[1Kgs.7.45|1Kgs 7:45]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרוּק‎</span> [[2Chr.4.16|2Chr 4:16]] (compare [[Lev.6.21|Lev 6:21]]); and shining <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֻצְהָב‎</span> [[Ezra.8.27|Ezra 8:27]]. On <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קָלָל‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Ezek.1.7|Ezek 1:7]]; [[Dan.10.6|Dan 10:6]] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קלל‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> as spoil of war [[2Sam.8.8|2Sam 8:8]]; [[2Kgs.25.13|2Kgs 25:13]] = [[Jer.52.17|Jer 52:17]]; [[Jer.52.20|Jer 52:20]] etc. 

**2.** ***fetters of copper*** or ***bronze***, usually dual [[Judg.16.21|Judg 16:21]]; [[2Sam.3.34|2Sam 3:34]]; [[2Kgs.25.7|2Kgs 25:7]] = [[Jer.39.7|Jer 39:7]]; [[Jer.52.11|Jer 52:11]]; [[2Chr.36.6|2Chr 36:6]], also [[2Chr.33.11|2Chr 33:11]] singular only [[Lam.3.7|Lam 3:7]] (figurative of oppression). 

**3.** as less in value than gold but more than wood [[Isa.60.17|Isa 60:17]] (twice in verse); figurative of worthless people [[Jer.6.28|Jer 6:28]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּרְזֶל‎</span>), ***id.*** (as dross of silver) [[Ezek.22.18|Ezek 22:18]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּדִיל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בַּרְזֶל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עוֺפֶרֶת‎</span>). — On [[Ezek.16.36|Ezek 16:36]] see IV.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נחשׁ‎</span>. 

**4.** figurative of pitiless sky [[Deut.28.23|Deut 28:23]]. 



 II. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְח֫שֶׁת‎</span>] **noun [feminine]** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתֵּךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.16.36|Ezek 16:36]] where context (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֶרְוָה‎</span>) favours meaning ***lust, harlotry***, or specific sens. obscoen. ([[BDB#Co|Co]] [citing [[BDB#Ki|Ki]] Ra] [[BDB#Berthol|Berthol]], see also [[BDB#Da|Da]]); text perhaps corrupt (compare [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>ZMG xl (1886). 730</sup>); [[BDB#Sm|Sm]] proposes <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּזְנוּתַיִךְ‎</span>, so apparently Toy<sup>Hpt</sup>; Or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּשְׁתֵּךְ‎</span>.
